learning_outcomes.description: Outline the production principles and develop suitable production goals and targets for the animals studied
Assess the quality of production outputs from ruminants
Evaluate methods to improve the quality of production outputs from ruminants
Construct management plans including general husbandry, nutrition, reproduction and health aspects for the animals studied
Evaluate the economic viability of an enterprise
Critically evaluate a welfare issue present in Australian ruminant production system
Competently handle small and large ruminants - IN PERSON MODE ONLY
Illustrate how to competently handle small and large ruminants - EXTERNAL MODE ONLY

assessments.task_description:
Students must complete the online practical activities. Practical activities will open on Friday of the preceding week, and remain open for ONE Week. 

 

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Click 'Save and Submit' at the end of the Blackboard Quiz to submit your answers.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
One case study report is to be completed.

Students will choose one (1) from three (3) options based on beef cattle, sheep, or goat enterprises.

Details will be announced and an outline provided on blackboard.

 

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
End of semester exam covering all material presented in the course.

The exam will be an on-campus exam. Have your UQ student ID card available for all your exams. Students enrolled in External delivery must attend the exam in-person at an approved off-campus venue.
